did.abstract: The Michigan Silversmiths Guild was established in 1948 to provide support to silversmiths and those artisans who work in other metals through workshops, exhibitions, and other activities. Articles of incorporation and constitutions, history, minutes of executive board, membership lists, announcements and other mailings to members, and photographs.
did.physloc: Offsite storage; prior notification required for access

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: This record group was deposited by the Michigan Silversmiths Guild (donor no. 9152) in 2001.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box no., Michigan Silversmiths Guild Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: The Michigan Silversmiths Guild was organized in 1948. The purpose of the organization was "to gather together those people who attained such proficiency in the broad field of silversmithing, jewelry and metal craft that they would be interested in obtaining more advance information and instruction through lectures and demonstrations of invited artists and craftsman in this field." The original constitution written in 1949 specified that the artisan work in silver, but this was later amended to include other metals. The Silversmiths Guild continues to hold exhibitions and workshops in the metropolitan Detroit area.

scopecontent.p: The records of the Michigan Silversmiths Guild document the activities and educational programs of the guild and include correspondence, minutes, articles of incorporation and constitution, histories, membership lists and photographs. The records are divided into three series: Articles of Incorporation and Founding Documents, Yearly files, and Photographs and Albums.

did.unittitle: Articles of Incorporation and Founding Documents

scopecontent.p: The Articles of Incorporation and Founding Documents series (0.1 linear feet) contains the documents of the organization of the guild. Included are a history of both board meetings and general activities, an undated membership list, and a copy of the original proposal to form the guild.

The Yearly files series (1 linear foot) documents the administrative activities of the guild. As the guild operates on a year that runs from September to August, the records were maintained in this same way. Yearly files usually include board meeting minutes, correspondence, meeting notices, and other materials. The guild began distributing a newsletter in 1977-1978. These newsletters can be found filed with the meeting announcements. These yearly files may also contain information about special events and activities. These would include the thirtieth anniversary exhibition in 1977-1978 and workshops sponsored by the Guild (beginning 1993-1994).

did.unittitle: Tom Muir Fabrications and Mechanisms Workshop
Barbara Minor Enameling on Formed Metal Workshop
Darlys Ewoldt Raising, Forming and Construction of Vessel Workshop
Jon Michael Route Pewter Box-Making Workshop
Dennis Nahabetian Working with Mesh Workshop
Lee Marshall Busic Hydraulic Forming Workshop
Allison Parks Spring Tension and Slide Clasps Workshop
Tom Madden The Other White Metal -- Pewter Workshop

scopecontent.p: Photographs in the Photographs and Albums series (0.4 linear feet) are arranged in as close to chronological order as possible. There are two autographed photographs of Paula Blanchard with a display case of Michigan Silversmiths Guild work and other unidentified people. Also included are workshop photographs, an album of photographs (1973), and a scrapbook of various guild events.
